chunks.text:
We have received the terms and conditions from the company that will be our 3PL partner (Salesupply Italy), and we would like to request your review of the document.

 

Following my initial assessment, I would like to highlight the following points for your consideration and potential revision:

 

*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

 

*	Deposit and Lien: They request a deposit equivalent to two months of shipping costs and retain a broad lien over our goods, including the right to block or sell goods in case of unpaid invoices. We suggest negotiating a formal notice period and safeguards before any exercise of retention or sale rights.

 

*	Price Changes: The agreement allows for unilateral price changes with only 30 days’ notice (and pandemic surcharges with just 24 hours’ notice). We recommend negotiating a longer notice period (e.g., 60 days) and, if possible, setting a reasonable annual cap on increases.

 

*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

metadata.doc_id: C1T40MG - request for review – 3pl partner terms and conditions\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C1T40MG - request for review – 3pl partner terms and conditions\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

 

*	Insurance: While we plan to independently insure our inventory via Shopify's recommended partner (Assureful) or an equivalent provider, we recommend clarifying that Salesupply must also carry basic operational warehouse insurance. They should remain liable for any damages caused by their negligence or operational errors. Additionally, we would appreciate your advice on what level and type of warehouse insurance coverage would typically be considered standard if we were operating our own warehouse, so we can better benchmark what is reasonable to expect from the 3PL provider and where we may need to secure additional protection independently.

 

*	Customer Shipping Protection: We are considering offering optional customer shipping protection at checkout (such as Route), although this has not yet been finalized. (No need to refer to this part this is just added information I am putting here for all of us to have visibility, this is unrelated to them)

 

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

chunks.text:
*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

 

*	GDPR Compliance: The data processing terms seem generally aligned with GDPR requirements, but we would appreciate your confirmation that they are sufficient for our current and future operational scope, particularly regarding the handling of customer personal data.

 

*	Exit Terms: The agreement allows them to charge hourly fees for exit support and stock transition. We suggest negotiating a cap on these costs or agreeing in advance on a clear exit plan to avoid unpredictable charges.

 

*	Governing Law: The agreement is governed by Italian law, with disputes handled in either Varese or Milan. We recommend, if possible, requesting jurisdiction to be limited to Milan courts only, for consistency and simplicity.

 

Please let us know your thoughts and recommendations.

 

Kind regards,

To: Sara Rebeiz; Faraz Hasan; Zain Manna
Cc: Martina Taborga; Joaquin Mencia; Farah Nassour
Subject: Request for Review – 3PL Partner Terms and Conditions 

 

 

Dear Sara & Faraz, 

 

Hope you had a nice weekend!

 

We have received the terms and conditions from the company that will be our 3PL partner (Salesupply Italy), and we would like to request your review of the document.

 

Following my initial assessment, I would like to highlight the following points for your consideration and potential revision:

 

*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C1T40MG - request for review – 3pl partner terms and conditions\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

 

*	Deposit and Lien: They request a deposit equivalent to two months of shipping costs and retain a broad lien over our goods, including the right to block or sell goods in case of unpaid invoices. We suggest negotiating a formal notice period and safeguards before any exercise of retention or sale rights.

 

*	Price Changes: The agreement allows for unilateral price changes with only 30 days’ notice (and pandemic surcharges with just 24 hours’ notice). We recommend negotiating a longer notice period (e.g., 60 days) and, if possible, setting a reasonable annual cap on increases.

 

*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

chunks.text:
*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

 

*	Insurance: While we plan to independently insure our inventory via Shopify's recommended partner (Assureful) or an equivalent provider, we recommend clarifying that Salesupply must also carry basic operational warehouse insurance. They should remain liable for any damages caused by their negligence or operational errors. Additionally, we would appreciate your advice on what level and type of warehouse insurance coverage would typically be considered standard if we were operating our own warehouse, so we can better benchmark what is reasonable to expect from the 3PL provider and where we may need to secure additional protection independently.

 

*	Customer Shipping Protection: We are considering offering optional customer shipping protection at checkout (such as Route), although this has not yet been finalized. (No need to refer to this part this is just added information I am putting here for all of us to have visibility, this is unrelated to them)

 

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

 

*	GDPR Compliance: The data processing terms seem generally aligned with GDPR requirements, but we would appreciate your confirmation that they are sufficient for our current and future operational scope, particularly regarding the handling of customer personal data.

 

*	Exit Terms: The agreement allows them to charge hourly fees for exit support and stock transition. We suggest negotiating a cap on these costs or agreeing in advance on a clear exit plan to avoid unpredictable charges.

 

*	Governing Law: The agreement is governed by Italian law, with disputes handled in either Varese or Milan. We recommend, if possible, requesting jurisdiction to be limited to Milan courts only, for consistency and simplicity.

 

Please let us know your thoughts and recommendations.

 

Kind regards,

 

ANA CANADAS​​​​

We have received the terms and conditions from the company that will be our 3PL partner (Salesupply Italy), and we would like to request your review of the document.

 

Following my initial assessment, I would like to highlight the following points for your consideration and potential revision:

 

*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

 

*	Deposit and Lien: They request a deposit equivalent to two months of shipping costs and retain a broad lien over our goods, including the right to block or sell goods in case of unpaid invoices. We suggest negotiating a formal notice period and safeguards before any exercise of retention or sale rights.

 

*	Price Changes: The agreement allows for unilateral price changes with only 30 days’ notice (and pandemic surcharges with just 24 hours’ notice). We recommend negotiating a longer notice period (e.g., 60 days) and, if possible, setting a reasonable annual cap on increases.

 

*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

 

*	Insurance: While we plan to independently insure our inventory via Shopify's recommended partner (Assureful) or an equivalent provider, we recommend clarifying that Salesupply must also carry basic operational warehouse insurance. They should remain liable for any damages caused by their negligence or operational errors. Additionally, we would appreciate your advice on what level and type of warehouse insurance coverage would typically be considered standard if we were operating our own warehouse, so we can better benchmark what is reasonable to expect from the 3PL provider and where we may need to secure additional protection independently.

 

*	Customer Shipping Protection: We are considering offering optional customer shipping protection at checkout (such as Route), although this has not yet been finalized. (No need to refer to this part this is just added information I am putting here for all of us to have visibility, this is unrelated to them)

 

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

 

*	GDPR Compliance: The data processing terms seem generally aligned with GDPR requirements, but we would appreciate your confirmation that they are sufficient for our current and future operational scope, particularly regarding the handling of customer personal data.

 

*	Exit Terms: The agreement allows them to charge hourly fees for exit support and stock transition. We suggest negotiating a cap on these costs or agreeing in advance on a clear exit plan to avoid unpredictable charges.

 

*	Governing Law: The agreement is governed by Italian law, with disputes handled in either Varese or Milan. We recommend, if possible, requesting jurisdiction to be limited to Milan courts only, for consistency and simplicity.

 

Please let us know your thoughts and recommendations.

 

Kind regards,

 

ANA CANADAS​​​​

Generally the terms are extremely one sided and there are attempts to disclaim liability throughout the document - its quite high risk. I've amended those but due to the frequency, as well as generally unclear terms, there's quite a fair bit of mark up

Note also that:


1.	
	Liability - we've increased the cap tenfold and carved out that damage to goods is limited to the actual goods value.
2.	
	Deposit - please confirm how you want to deal wit the deposit.
3.	
	Lien - I have removed reference to the Lien - we usually do not agree to liens on goods at all.
4.	
	Price changes - have amended to 60 day notice and 5% cap.
5.	
	Term and Termination - I have amended this to 1 year term, with no auto renewal, and a 1 month termination provision at any time. This should be a minimum and termination for convenience should be a mandatory condition to us signing, given the terms.
6.	
	Insurance - I have added general language however please check those with @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> .
7.	
	Direct Debit - Removed and language for bank transfer added.
8.	
	Data Protection - Terms need a full review by the DPO office @Salma Shaheen <mailto:Salma.Shaheen@chalhoub.com> 
9.	
	Exit Terms - These now require mutual agreement.
10.	
	Governing law - amended.
11.	
	IT Security - I would strongly recommend checking with IT security regarding this provider if they are to any way integrate into our systems - they may need to agree to our Group Security Schedule.


Best,
Faraz

To: Sara Rebeiz; Faraz Hasan; Zain Manna
Cc: Martina Taborga; Joaquin Mencia; Farah Nassour
Subject: Request for Review – 3PL Partner Terms and Conditions

 

 

Dear Sara & Faraz, 

 

Hope you had a nice weekend!

 

We have received the terms and conditions from the company that will be our 3PL partner (Salesupply Italy), and we would like to request your review of the document.

 

Following my initial assessment, I would like to highlight the following points for your consideration and potential revision:

 

*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

chunks.text:
*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

 

*	Deposit and Lien: They request a deposit equivalent to two months of shipping costs and retain a broad lien over our goods, including the right to block or sell goods in case of unpaid invoices. We suggest negotiating a formal notice period and safeguards before any exercise of retention or sale rights.

 

*	Price Changes: The agreement allows for unilateral price changes with only 30 days’ notice (and pandemic surcharges with just 24 hours’ notice). We recommend negotiating a longer notice period (e.g., 60 days) and, if possible, setting a reasonable annual cap on increases.

 

*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

chunks.text:
*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

 

*	Insurance: While we plan to independently insure our inventory via Shopify's recommended partner (Assureful) or an equivalent provider, we recommend clarifying that Salesupply must also carry basic operational warehouse insurance. They should remain liable for any damages caused by their negligence or operational errors. Additionally, we would appreciate your advice on what level and type of warehouse insurance coverage would typically be considered standard if we were operating our own warehouse, so we can better benchmark what is reasonable to expect from the 3PL provider and where we may need to secure additional protection independently.

 

*	Customer Shipping Protection: We are considering offering optional customer shipping protection at checkout (such as Route), although this has not yet been finalized. (No need to refer to this part this is just added information I am putting here for all of us to have visibility, this is unrelated to them)

 

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

 

*	GDPR Compliance: The data processing terms seem generally aligned with GDPR requirements, but we would appreciate your confirmation that they are sufficient for our current and future operational scope, particularly regarding the handling of customer personal data.

 

*	Exit Terms: The agreement allows them to charge hourly fees for exit support and stock transition. We suggest negotiating a cap on these costs or agreeing in advance on a clear exit plan to avoid unpredictable charges.

 

*	Governing Law: The agreement is governed by Italian law, with disputes handled in either Varese or Milan. We recommend, if possible, requesting jurisdiction to be limited to Milan courts only, for consistency and simplicity.

 

Please let us know your thoughts and recommendations.

 

Kind regards,

 

ANA CANADAS​​​​

Generally the terms are extremely one sided and there are attempts to disclaim liability throughout the document - its quite high risk. I've amended those but due to the frequency, as well as generally unclear terms, there's quite a fair bit of mark up

 

Note also that:

 

1.	Liability - we've increased the cap tenfold and carved out that damage to goods is limited to the actual goods value.
2.	Deposit - please confirm how you want to deal wit the deposit.
3.	Lien - I have removed reference to the Lien - we usually do not agree to liens on goods at all.
4.	Price changes - have amended to 60 day notice and 5% cap.
5.	Term and Termination - I have amended this to 1 year term, with no auto renewal, and a 1 month termination provision at any time. This should be a minimum and termination for convenience should be a mandatory condition to us signing, given the terms.
6.	Insurance - I have added general language however please check those with @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> .
7.	Direct Debit - Removed and language for bank transfer added.
8.	Data Protection - Terms need a full review by the DPO office @Salma Shaheen <mailto:Salma.Shaheen@chalhoub.com> 
9.	Exit Terms - These now require mutual agreement.
10.	Governing law - amended.
11.	IT Security - I would strongly recommend checking with IT security regarding this provider if they are to any way integrate into our systems - they may need to agree to our Group Security Schedule.

 

Best,

Faraz

From: Ana Canadas
Sent: Monday, April 28, 2025 11:14 AM
To: Sara Rebeiz; Faraz Hasan; Zain Manna
Cc: Martina Taborga; Joaquin Mencia; Farah Nassour
Subject: Request for Review – 3PL Partner Terms and Conditions

 

 

Dear Sara & Faraz, 

 

Hope you had a nice weekend!

 

We have received the terms and conditions from the company that will be our 3PL partner (Salesupply Italy), and we would like to request your review of the document.

 

Following my initial assessment, I would like to highlight the following points for your consideration and potential revision:

 

*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

chunks.text:
*	Liability: The current liability cap (€5,000 per event and €20,000 per year) seems very low considering the potential value of our inventory. We recommend negotiating a higher liability cap or securing carve-outs in case of stock loss, operational failures, or gross negligence.

 

*	Deposit and Lien: They request a deposit equivalent to two months of shipping costs and retain a broad lien over our goods, including the right to block or sell goods in case of unpaid invoices. We suggest negotiating a formal notice period and safeguards before any exercise of retention or sale rights.

 

*	Price Changes: The agreement allows for unilateral price changes with only 30 days’ notice (and pandemic surcharges with just 24 hours’ notice). We recommend negotiating a longer notice period (e.g., 60 days) and, if possible, setting a reasonable annual cap on increases.

 

*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

chunks.text:
*	Termination: The 6-month minimum term is acceptable, but we suggest ensuring that we have the right to terminate immediately in the event of material breaches, operational failures, or risks to our stock.

 

*	Insurance: While we plan to independently insure our inventory via Shopify's recommended partner (Assureful) or an equivalent provider, we recommend clarifying that Salesupply must also carry basic operational warehouse insurance. They should remain liable for any damages caused by their negligence or operational errors. Additionally, we would appreciate your advice on what level and type of warehouse insurance coverage would typically be considered standard if we were operating our own warehouse, so we can better benchmark what is reasonable to expect from the 3PL provider and where we may need to secure additional protection independently.

 

*	Customer Shipping Protection: We are considering offering optional customer shipping protection at checkout (such as Route), although this has not yet been finalized. (No need to refer to this part this is just added information I am putting here for all of us to have visibility, this is unrelated to them)

 

*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

chunks.text:
*	SEPA Direct Debit Authorization: The contract requires automatic SEPA direct debit for invoice payments. We would prefer to retain control by paying manually via bank transfer against a standard 14-day payment term after invoice issuance. Please confirm if we can request this adjustment, as it aligns better with standard B2B practices and ensures appropriate oversight of payments.

 

*	GDPR Compliance: The data processing terms seem generally aligned with GDPR requirements, but we would appreciate your confirmation that they are sufficient for our current and future operational scope, particularly regarding the handling of customer personal data.

 

*	Exit Terms: The agreement allows them to charge hourly fees for exit support and stock transition. We suggest negotiating a cap on these costs or agreeing in advance on a clear exit plan to avoid unpredictable charges.

 

*	Governing Law: The agreement is governed by Italian law, with disputes handled in either Varese or Milan. We recommend, if possible, requesting jurisdiction to be limited to Milan courts only, for consistency and simplicity.

 

Please let us know your thoughts and recommendations.

 

Kind regards,

 

ANA CANADAS​​​​

Hi Ana,

Note also that:

chunks.text:
Generally the terms are extremely one sided and there are attempts to disclaim liability throughout the document - its quite high risk. I've amended those but due to the frequency, as well as generally unclear terms, there's quite a fair bit of mark up

 

Note also that:

 

1.	Liability - we've increased the cap tenfold and carved out that damage to goods is limited to the actual goods value.
2.	Deposit - please confirm how you want to deal wit the deposit.
3.	Lien - I have removed reference to the Lien - we usually do not agree to liens on goods at all.
4.	Price changes - have amended to 60 day notice and 5% cap.
5.	Term and Termination - I have amended this to 1 year term, with no auto renewal, and a 1 month termination provision at any time. This should be a minimum and termination for convenience should be a mandatory condition to us signing, given the terms.
6.	Insurance - I have added general language however please check those with @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> .
7.	Direct Debit - Removed and language for bank transfer added.
8.	Data Protection - Terms need a full review by the DPO office @Salma Shaheen <mailto:Salma.Shaheen@chalhoub.com> 
9.	Exit Terms - These now require mutual agreement.
10.	Governing law - amended.
11.	IT Security - I would strongly recommend checking with IT security regarding this provider if they are to any way integrate into our systems - they may need to agree to our Group Security Schedule.

 

Best,

Faraz

 

 

 

FARAZ HASAN

MANAGER ‑ LEGAL

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI
